intro: Cryptandra microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed cryptandra, is a shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid climates of its native habitat. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
